body.p: WebHelp Responsive output can be configured to work with multiple search engines.

The WebHelp Responsive plugin comes with an embedded JS based search engine configured by default. This search engine is recommended for a small or medium-sized documentation, offering a fairly good set of features such as sorting results by relevance, 5-star rating mechanism, custom rules for element scoring.

In addition to the embedded JS search engine, the WebHelp Responsive output can be easily configured to use the search engine from Oxygen Feedback product. This is a more advanced search engine, suitable for large documentation, and with a wider range of features: semantic search, faceted search or labels search.
If none of the above options represent a choice, then the WebHelp Responsive transformation can be configured to work with an external search engine. See the topics for more details.
